edu.bu.segrelab.comets
Class CometsSetupPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  edu.bu.segrelab.comets.CometsSetupPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
CometsConstants, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class CometsSetupPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements CometsConstants

The CometsSetupPanel has the role of letting the user initialize and customize the contents of the world before running a simulation.

This also contains a separate GraphicsSetupPanel class that handles the graphic display of what's being setup in the world. It pains me to say that much of that code is copied from the CometsRunPanel. Eventually, I plan to merge the two, once I work out some threading issues. Maybe if I put the graphical updating in its own thread? Mimic the PApplet thread system somehow?

For now, they're separate. That makes the code more functional than pretty, I'm afraid. Eric Roberts would have my liver if he knew what this former 106A student did.

Anyway.

The setup panel also builds and controls a CometsToolbarPanel that works as a toolbar palette - similar to common paint programs. Most of the tools work by interacting directly with the GraphicSetupPanel: any mouse command that is done to the graphic panel is just passed along to the selected tool.

Right clicking on the GraphicSetupPanel will allow the user to set biomass and media in either individual spaces, or in a set of selected spaces. This is done through locally maintained DataContentPanels (separate from those used by the CometsToolbarPanel for tool interactions).

Author:
Bill Riehl
See Also:
Serialized Form

Builds a new CometsSetupPanel and links it to the Comets instance.

Parameters:

Method Detail

clear

public void clear()
Clears the content of the setup panel. This removes any content panel information set by the user, and affects both the information from this setup panel and the associated toolbar panel.

getMediaPanel

public DataContentPanel getMediaPanel()
Returns the DataContentPanel used for representing media, or null if no Models are loaded.

Returns:
a DataContentPanel with media information, or null

getBiomassPanel

public DataContentPanel getBiomassPanel()
Returns the DataContentPanel used for representing biomass, or null if no Models are loaded.

Returns:
a DataContentPanel with biomass information, or null

showLayoutToolbar

public void showLayoutToolbar(boolean b)
Either shows or hides the CometsToolbarPanel containing a tool palette.

Parameters:
b - - if true, show the panel, if false, hide it.

getActiveTool

public AbstractTool getActiveTool()
Returns:
the currently selected tool in the CometsToolbarPanel.

setSelectionShape

public void setSelectionShape(java.awt.Shape shape)
Sets a selection shape in the GraphicSetupPanel. The main function of this shape is to show the user what region is selected/being drawn on/moused over/etc. This shape is drawn by the GraphicSetupPanel.

Parameters:
shape - - a Shape to be drawn on the screen.

selectSpaces

public void selectSpaces(java.util.ArrayList points)
"Selects" a set of spaces in the GraphicSetupPanel. Any right-click operation done on that panel is done to the entire set of selected spaces. Every Point in the passed ArrayList is expected to correspond to a space on the world grid.

Parameters:
points - - an ArrayList of Points.

applyBiomassChange

public void applyBiomassChange(java.awt.Point p,
                               boolean overwrite)
Changes the biomass concentrations in the world at the given point p. The new values used are set by the values in the DataContentPanel. If the overwrite parameter is false, then the values in the biomass content panel are added to the current concentrations in the space.

Parameters:
p - - the point to apply the new biomass.
overwrite - - if true, set the concentrations at p to be those in the biomass DataContentPanel, otherwise just add to the current values at p.
See Also:
getBiomassPanel()

applyBiomassChange

public void applyBiomassChange(double[] values,
                               java.awt.Point p,
                               boolean overwrite)
Changes the biomass concentrations in the world at the given point p. If the overwrite parameter is false, then the passed values are added to the current concentrations in the space.

Parameters:
values - - the biomass values to adjust the space with.
p - - the point to apply the new biomass.
overwrite - - if true, set the concentrations at p to be those in the values parameter, otherwise just add to the current values at p.

applyBiomassChange

public void applyBiomassChange(java.util.ArrayList points,
                               boolean overwrite)
Changes the biomass concentrations in the world at all points in the given ArrayList. The new values used are set by the values in the DataContentPanel. If the overwrite parameter is false, then the values in the biomass content panel are added to the current concentrations in the space.

Parameters:
points - - an ArrayList of Points to update.
overwrite - - if true, set the concentrations at each point to be those in the biomass DataContentPanel, otherwise just add to the current values at each of the points.
See Also:
getBiomassPanel()

applyBiomassChange

public void applyBiomassChange(double[] values,
                               java.util.ArrayList points,
                               boolean overwrite)
Changes the biomass concentrations in the world at all points in the given ArrayList. The new values used are set by the values in the passed array. If the overwrite parameter is false, then the passed values added to the current concentrations in each space in the ArrayList.

Parameters:
values - - the biomass values to adjust the space with.
points - - an ArrayList of Points to update.
overwrite - - if true, set the concentrations at each point to be those in the values parameter, otherwise just add to the current values at each point.

applyMediaChange

public void applyMediaChange(java.awt.Point p,
                             boolean overwrite)
Changes the media concentrations in the world at the given point p. The new values used are set by the values in the DataContentPanel. If the overwrite parameter is false, then the values in the media content panel are added to the current concentrations in the space.

Parameters:
p - - the point to apply the new media.
overwrite - - if true, set the concentrations at p to be those in the media DataContentPanel, otherwise just add to the current values at p.
See Also:
getMediaPanel()

setBarrier

public void setBarrier(java.awt.Point p,
                       boolean barrier)
Adds or removes a barrier at world point p.

Parameters:
p - - the grid coordinate to add or remove a barrier space.
barrier - - if true, set the space to be a barrier, otherwise remove the barrier.

setBarrier

public void setBarrier(java.util.ArrayList points,
                       boolean barrier)
Adds or removes a barrier from each space signified by the ArrayList of Points.

Parameters:
points - - an ArrayList of Points in the world
barrier - - if true, set all spaces to be a barrier, otherwise remove the barrier from all given spaces.
